poem:
"Borders on Canvas"

Oh, museum walls, stoic keepers of time!
How run your veins, alight with bottled hues,
where Renoir dances, just shy of the line.
A cut-off, slight as the waning moon's crescent,
casts shade in the halls of aching beauty.
Yet, within these arbitrary strokes of dates,
unending stories pulse with rhythmic truth,
and art, timeless, dares to laugh at gates.
